We're here to help you grow as a self-learner.

EduLift combines tried and tested pedagogic methodology with innovative software in order to improve the way you learn.

LinguaLift

Learn to impress in a foreign language

Study from the comfort of your browser, delight friends & clients in their mother tongue.

Start learning

It can be hard to find optimal spacing between lessons and review sessions. LinguaLift cleverly does all the heavy lifting and gives everything an autodidact would need in one place, so you never run out of things to learn next.

— Robbin, Learning Japanese with LinguaLift
Fluent Panda

Forget about forgetting languages

Grow your panda as you learn with fun and interactive bite-sized lessons, help the underprivileged learn English for free. Kickstarter Staff Pick and Most-Funded Mobile Game.

See our campaign
Study on the go

Fluent Panda has been designed from the grounds-up for the small screen, and the time-poor but motivation-rich language self-learner.

Never forget

Fluent Panda builds on decades of research in linguistics and neuroscience, and our advanced spaced repetition algorithms remind you just before you forget.

Learn actionable language

Fluent Panda is the missing link between traditional learning resources and actually using the language. Acquire context-specific fluency and sound like a native.

Nurture a panda

Grow and upgrade your very own virtual Fluent Panda as you successfully complete new lessons. Log in regularly so your panda stays in good shape!

So excited for this program coming from the team behind LinguaLift! The creators of this project know how to make language learning engaging, challenging, and fun. Like other backers, I am confident in this product and in the team behind it.

— Stacey, backer from Canada
Online Language Learners Guild

Get field-tested, data-driven advice to learn languages faster and more effectively.

This course comes with our frustration that so many talented people still can’t achieve their dream of fluency in another language. Through discussions with industry experts, advice from those who have managed fluency, and analysis of study data from over 70,000 self-learners.
